landlord_tenant_relationship.reasoning: Complaint alleges Defendant is owner/landlord of 123 Maple Street and that Plaintiff has been a tenant there since March 1, 2022, paying monthly rent (¶2–4), which sufficiently pleads a landlord–tenant relationship.

act_or_omission_by_landlord.reasoning: Complaint pleads specific omissions and conduct by Defendant: Plaintiff notified Defendant of water intrusion and Defendant failed to timely repair or abate the condition despite repeated notice (¶7–9, 12); Defendant also communicated a nonrenewal/retaliatory intent (¶13, 19).

substantial_interference.reasoning: Complaint alleges persistent water intrusion and code violations documented by City inspectors, ruined personal property (rug and bookshelf), continuous need to run a dehumidifier, increased utility costs, and diminished habitability/use (¶9–11, 14, 17), which, taken together, adequately plead a ‘‘substantial interference.’”,

causation.reasoning: Complaint alleges a causal chain: heavy rain led to water intrusion; Plaintiff notified Defendant; Defendant failed to repair; City inspection confirmed defects; as a direct result Plaintiff’s property was damaged and dampness persisted (¶7–11, 12, 17).

damages.reasoning: Complaint specifies actual damages including damaged personal property (≈$400), increased utility expenses from the dehumidifier, loss of use/diminished habitability, and consequential damages (¶10–11, 20; Prayer A), sufficiently pleading damages.
